ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Weakness below surface, such as voids, tanks, and loose fill
-   Weakness on the surface, such as retaining walls, slopes, excavations, and depressions
-   Firm, drained, and graded ground conditions for adequate support
-   Job brief and overhead obstructions
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the ability of supporting surfaces to handle the expected loads. Elements of concern include, but are not limited to:
Know electric power line hazards, corresponding regulations, and safety practices

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Access to the job site
-  Site hazards, such as underground utilities
-  Transportation clearances
-  Traffic control
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to identify and evaluate hazards associated with:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Lift/job plan
-  Travel clearance
-  Ground support
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to review lift requirements with site supervision, including:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Qualified employees
-  Unauthorized public
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know site restrictions regarding personnel:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Controls
-  Safety devices
-  Operator aids
-  Visual/audible warning devices
-  Pre-travel and DOT inspection
-  Structural/mechanical
-  Load lines, hooks, rigging
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know and perform the following inspections:
Know the requirements for personal protective equipment

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Load charts
-  Clearance/minimum approach distances
-  Rigging
-  Signalperson
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to plan the job, including:
Know the requirements for grounding and/or barricading

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Positioning and securing of the vehicle
-  Outriggers
-  Slopes
-  Ice and snow
-  Pads, mats, blocking, and cribbing
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know and understand the proper setup of digger derricks, including:
Know the purpose of decals and placards
Know the requirements for operating in various weather conditions and understand how environmental conditions affect the safe operation of the digger derrick
Understand the operation of all controls and components

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Insulated
-  Non-insulated
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Have general knowledge of booms, platforms, liners

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: -  Loading/unloading from trailers
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to prepare the digger derrick for transportation:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  ANSI/ASSE A10.31
-  OSHA 1910.180
-  OSHA 1926 Subpart CC
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know which federal regulations and industry standards affect safe operations of digger derricks, including, but not limited to:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: -  Insulated/non-insulated parts
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Have specific knowledge of dielectric protection and safety
Know the proper use of material handling and phase lifting equipment
Know how to identify unsafe equipment conditions/deficiencies and when to notify supervision
Know how to swing and place the load smoothly and safely
Know proper procedures for multiple–part line reeving

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Hand signals
-  Voice signals
-  Non-standard/special
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know standard method signals as specified in OSHA 1926 Subpart CC
Know how to shut down and secure the digger derrick properly when leaving it unattended
Know how to verify the capacity of the digger derrick, weight of the load, rigging, and path prior to initiating the lift
Know basic load rigging procedures

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Digger derrick level indicator
-  Hydraulic outrigger holding/check valve devices
-  Horn
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to use and understand the requirements for safety devices, including:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Load weight indicating device (LMI, LML, rated load indicator)
-  Anti two-block device
-  Boom angle indicator
-  Outrigger position sensors/monitors
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know and understand the requirements for operational aids and temporary alternative measures for:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Operating near electric power lines
-  Traveling under or near power lines
-  Using a personnel platform
-  Lifting loads from beneath the surface of the water
-  Lifting stuck or embedded loads
-  Handling loads out of the operator’s vision (“operating in the blind”)
-  Swing radius hazards
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the proper procedure for operating safely under the following conditions:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Insulated tools/PPE
-  Tag lines
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know proper procedures for load control, including the use of:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Overhead/underground utility line contact
-  Loss of stability
-  Control malfunction
-  Block and line twisting
-  Personnel under load or in fall zone
-  Fire
-  Two-blocking
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to react to emergency conditions like:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Wind and weather
-  Stopping and starting
-  Impact loading
-  Moving the load
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the effects of dynamic loading from:
Know the effect of side loading
Know the operator’s authority to stop operations

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Fall-protection (including guard rails, gates, and PPE)
-  Combined use
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Platform work:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Stowing/unstowing boom
-  Stowing/unstowing auger
-  Storing/unstoring equipment
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the requirements of:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Digging
-  Screw anchor installation
-  Pole setting
-  Pole pulling
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the requirements for the following operations:
Know basic digger derrick terminology and definitions
Know functions and limitations of the digger derrick

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Construction and working load limit
-  Inspection procedures and replacement criteria
-  Capacity, line pull, multi-part reeving
-  Care and maintenance
-  Lubrication of wire rope
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know load line (wire and synthetic):

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Slings
-  Spreaders
-  Lifting beams
-  Rigging hardware
-  Saddles (softeners)
-  Hooks
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know rigging devices

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: -  Assembly/disassembly in proximity to power lines
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the limitations of protective measures against electrical hazards:
Know the effects of the load share and load transfer in multi-digger derrick lifts
Know the significance of the instruments and gauge readings

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Shift/frequent
-  Monthly/periodic
-  Annual/comprehensive
-  Records
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the requirements for inspections and maintenance

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Anchor adaptors
-  Jibs
-  Pole pullers
-  Augers
-  Phase lifting equipment
-  Aftermarket attachments
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to use attachments/accessories and their effect on the digger derrick’s operations
Know requirements for fall protection
Know requirements for access and egress
Know the general requirements that apply to assembly/disassembly operations

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Equipment familiarization
-  General training
-  Retraining/recertification
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the requirements of operator qualification/certification:
Know the operations and requirements for the use of winches

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: WRITTEN EXAM DOMAIN 5: MANUFACTURERS' LOAD CHARTS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know the terminology necessary to use load charts

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: WRITTEN EXAM DOMAIN 5: MANUFACTURERS' LOAD CHARTS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to ensure that the load chart is the appropriate chart for the machine in its particular application

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: WRITTEN EXAM DOMAIN 5: MANUFACTURERS' LOAD CHARTS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Operational limitations of load charts and notes
-  Difference between structural capacity and capacity limited by stability
-  What is included in load chart capacity
-  The range diagram and its relationship to the load chart
-  The work area chart and its relationship to the load chart
-  Where to find and how to use the parts-of-line information
-  The safe working load of hoist line
-  Appropriate load-handling deductions
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to use capacity load charts, including:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: WRITTEN EXAM DOMAIN 5: MANUFACTURERS' LOAD CHARTS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Hydraulic overload protection gauge
-  Load weighing devices
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to use the load chart with:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: WRITTEN EXAM DOMAIN 5: MANUFACTURERS' LOAD CHARTS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Know how to calculate net capacity for the digger derrick configuration using the applicable manufacturer’s load charts

ceterms:assessmentExampleDescription:
It is always the operator’s responsibility to:

a.    Know the load weight before lifting
b.   Assure that a suitable digger derrick has been assigned to the job
c.   Designate a qualified signalperson
d.   Supervise the rigging crew
ceterms:assessmentOutput: CCO Written Examinations are electronically scored off-site at NCCCO facilities. For this reason, it is important to complete the answer sheet according to the instructions provided by the Chief Examiner on the day of the exam. Candidates will receive credit only for answers recorded on the scannable answer sheet. Answers marked in the test booklet(s) will NOT be counted toward a candidate’s score. All candidates will receive a score report of their performance. Examination results are mailed to candidates approximately 12 business days after the examination administration.
ceterms:deliveryTypeDescription: Written exam is available as either a paper/pencil test or a computer-based test. The content of both exams is identical.
ceterms:description: The Digger Derrick Operator Written Examination has 75 multiple-choice questions. Candidates are allowed 90 minutes to complete the written examination. You must pass both the written exam and the practical exam to be certified for a five-year period. Candidates meeting the eligibility requirements may take either the Written Examination or the Practical Examination first.

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:name: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Written Exam
CCO Digger Derrick Operator Written Exam
ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: Pencil/paper test (current CCO-certified Mobile Crane Operators or new candidates who are registering for Mobile Crane Operator exams at same time)

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:name: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Written Exam
CCO Digger Derrick Operator Written Exam
ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: Computer-based test (current CCO-certified Mobile Crane Operators or new candidates who are registering for Mobile Crane Operator exams at same time)
